sections.text:
This feature adds consistent observability for scheduled sync jobs across our CRM, Support, and Product Analytics integrations so we can quickly understand what ran, what failed, and why. For each scheduled sync run, we will capture standardized logs and metrics including start/end timestamps, duration, records processed, API errors, and retries, creating a unified view of sync health across integration types.

The immediate impact is improved operational reliability and faster incident response. Today, diagnosing sync issues often requires piecing together partial logs or manually reproducing problems; with consistent metrics and error reporting, engineering and support can identify failure patterns (e.g., authentication errors, rate limits, bad payloads) and pinpoint where in the pipeline a job is breaking, reducing time-to-diagnosis and time-to-recovery.

We will also surface a per-connection sync status—last successful run and last failure reason—so internal teams (and potentially customers, depending on where it’s exposed) can see when data is stale and what action is needed. This increases transparency, reduces confusion when downstream dashboards or workflows appear out of date, and helps prioritize fixes by highlighting the most impacted connections.

Finally, this work is foundational for upcoming functional improvements to syncing. By establishing reliable instrumentation first, subsequent tickets can be validated with clear before/after measurements, and regressions can be detected early, enabling safer iteration and more predictable outcomes as we evolve our integrations.
